Activity: Log in, check emails. Spend 15 minutes browsing Blender subreddit.
Address to-do list from yesterday. Start with refining the character's anatomy based on feedback (if any) from yesterday's email to @Concept Artist. Re-save to new version: Character_Blockout_v02
Begin planning the character's rigging. Research joint placement for optimal deformation, particularly around the shoulders and hips. Make notes.
Start placing the initial joints for the character's skeleton in Maya. Focus on the spine, pelvis, and shoulders.
Lunch Break. Grab food with colleagues, discuss weekend plans.
Continue joint placement for the character's limbs, paying close attention to the knees, elbows, wrists, and ankles. Adjust placement based on anatomical considerations.
Test the initial joint placement with basic rotations. Identify any areas where the mesh deforms poorly and adjust joint positions accordingly.
Return to the environment model and add more detail to the ruined building. Start defining the shape of broken walls and adding details like rubble piles.
Review progress, identify areas for improvement on rigging and environment. Back up files and clean workspace.
